# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = [""] # Initialize an array to hold the wrapped lines
    for word in split(text)
        current_line = lines[end] # Get the last line
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            # If adding this word would exceed the width, add a new line and append the word
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        append!(lines[end], word * " ") # Append the word to the last line
    end
    return join(lines, "\n") # Join all lines with newline characters
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there, how are you today? This is a very long sentence that should wrap around."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function splits the text into words using `split` and then iterates over each word. For each word, it checks if adding it to the current line would exceed the specified `text_width`. If so, a new line is added. After processing all words, the lines are joined back together with newline characters between them.
